meanings.definition: To rent something out to someone.
meanings.sent1: I will yrent my bike to my friend for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: She decided to yrent her apartment to a new tenant.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to yrent the dog's bed for a change.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to yrent the sky with its golden rays.
meanings.sent5: The shop owner yrented out costumes for the Halloween party.

meanings.definition: The act of renting out property.
meanings.sent1: His yrent of the house helped him earn extra income.
meanings.sent2: The yrent of the office space was negotiated by the real estate agent.
meanings.sent3: The yrent of the beach house made the vacation even more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The yrent of the car park was a lucrative business for the owner.
meanings.sent5: The yrent of the equipment was essential for the event.

meanings.definition: The amount of money paid for renting property.
meanings.sent1: The monthly yrent for the apartment was reasonable.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to afford the yrent for her shop.
meanings.sent3: The high yrent for the villa made him reconsider his vacation plans.
meanings.sent4: The yrent for the studio apartment was surprisingly low.
meanings.sent5: He always paid his yrent on time to avoid any issues.
